website_summaries.verdict: While this vest has a 12 lb. weight maximum, many competitors offer a better overall fit and comfort level.
pros: Garners praise for its soft material and a convenient pocket that can hold a cell phone or MP3 player
cons: Some customers gripe about a poor overall fit, which leaves the vest too tight or not tight enough on certain frames

customer_reviews.title: ladies, wear it upside down.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this weighted vest because it was suggested as a "game changer" for my HIIT workouts. I really like it!! it is very comfortable and well made. The weight is mostly in the back, but there is some weight in the front. I give it 4 starts because it is not exceptionally adjustable. I am quite small framed (5ft tall, thin build). I wear it "upside down" so that the strap in front is under my boobs, that keeps it more secure. Overall i am highly pleased with this product and would highly recommend this product to others!
customer_reviews.author: chiraile8513

customer_reviews.title: Heavy on your neck, shoulders and upper back.
customer_reviews.text: I am a personal trainer and fitness professional. I bought this to use for myself and some of my more fit clients. After wearing it for 10 minutes, my neck was on fire. It was too much weight on my shoulders. Overall, I think the quality was okay and it was comfortable but I wouldn't recommend it for anyone with neck, shoulder or upper back issues. I wish they sold this in 8 to 10 lbs. Less weight would still provide a challenging workout without the neck strain. The fit was pretty good, I'm 5'3", 130lb, 36" chest.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Bullock

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty big - I do not recommend for smaller than a size large blouse wearer
customer_reviews.text: This vest is nice quality, but it's really very large and only adjustable to go larger. I am 5'6", 137lbs, muscular with a large rib cage. The vest is large enough that it sort of droops... and if I were to try to run in it or jump rope or do burpees, it would jump around to the point it would disrupt the exercise. I am quite disappointed as I spent a lot of time searching for the right vest, to fit a woman and be of good quality and while this vest is pretty close, it does not fit the bill unless you wear a size large or larger blouse.
customer_reviews.author: PCmommaOF3

customer_reviews.title: Loving it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my hikes. I was wearing an 8lb vest that was a little uncomfortable, now i know. When I changed for a heavier weight, I could instantly feel the comfort difference. Super comfy for everyday walks (no complaints) It’s comfortable enough to wear for 6 hr medium intense hikes. (Started to feel it digging in the shoulders towards the end of the hike) Comfortable enough to wear 2 hr difficult intense hikes. (Good sweat session) The little phone holder is pointless.
customer_reviews.author: Simple Angel

customer_reviews.title: SUPER POWER WALK❤️
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS WEIGHTED VEST. TURNED MY POWER WALK TO SUPER POWER WALK.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great Workout Vest
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son for offseason college football training. This is the perfect weight to emulate pads, helmets etc without the bulkiness. Here is what he likes about it: - Great fit, once on it does not slide around it feels like it is part of you - Cleans wells and dries well overnight - Very good weight distribution. Does not feel like there is any out of balance for the vest. - Materials seem to be high quality and will last him several seasons
customer_reviews.author: Stephen S.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, better to have the strap lower on the ribcage.
customer_reviews.text: This is what it says, 11 lbs seems heavier than I thought. It is a good quality. The little pouch wouldn't hold anything but maybe lip balm. Sometimes I wear it upside down. If you are bending forward it doesn't stay in place because the strap is too high. It does stay in place worn upside down because the strap is lower on the ribcage under the bra line. It is a snugger fit as well when worn upside down, but then the elastic band are on the shoulders.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I already had a weighted vest but it was bulky and pushed down on my boobs. So hate that! After months of researching (yep, I'm a researcher...lol) I decided on this. So happy. Clips into place no problem. Stays on no problem. It does sit close to the top of my boobs but so far no problem with that. You can definitely tell you have weight on you. My other vest was heavier and I would love a heavier option in this vest. I have never used the phone holder. Took it off the moment I got it and have stashed it away.
customer_reviews.author: crissy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Perfect!!! Exactly what I was looking for. I really wanted the bodyrock vest that Lisa uses but I just couldn’t justify spending a ridiculous amount money for it. I found mine on the Amazon warehouse deals for even cheaper and it’s perfect. I’m only 5 nothing and tiny and this vest fits perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Mamahoneybadger

customer_reviews.title: A must have in a runners routine
customer_reviews.text: Love this running vest! Fits very comfortable. I was looking for equipment that would help with my running time since I don't have much time to train. I added this in and wear it on my runs during my lunch break at work. It has helped me become a stronger and faster runner. Running without the vest makes me feel much lighter and I have taken 93 seconds off my 5K time so far!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Mullins

customer_reviews.title: Did not fit until I flipped it .. Now perfect fit!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this vest because it was very similar to the higher price body rock vest.. when I first put it on it did not fit as I expected.. of course I did my research and came across a body rock video where the girl flipped the vest and put it on upside down.. omg what a difference..Now it fits perfect.. she even went a step further to put Velcro adjuments on the shoulder elastic if it needed to be adjusted more.. but it worked just great once flipped!! It is now my best workout accessory!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: comfortable but loose
customer_reviews.text: Well made vest with evenly distributed weight. The problem is, even when tightened to the tightest setting, it is too loose and bounces more than is comfortable. Forget doing burpees - the vest practically comes up and over the head. I am a woman who is 5'8" tall and 130 pounds with a larger boned frame. Will continue to use but wish it was a much snugger fit.
customer_reviews.author: jsd

customer_reviews.title: Highly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: worst quality ever the elastic has fallen apart and the material has gotten holes at stitchings and loosing sand!!!! Very disappointed as I have ordered 3 of them and feel like I should have my money back or a new one!!
customer_reviews.author: Nadibene

customer_reviews.title: Weighted vests help trim fat!
customer_reviews.text: This vest really helped me to get into shape! Start slowly by walking with the vest so you don't shock your joints and tendons. Once you get used to the extra weight running with the vest helps with dropping pounds quickly and with strengthening the abdominal muscles.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Great walking vest
customer_reviews.text: This vest is great for walking and maybe a slower body weight workout like squats. It does not work for running, which was half the reason I needed a vest. It bounces on my shoulders and u der arms during a run so that's a bummer. I still wear it once a week for a long walk. For the price, it's still worth keeping.
customer_reviews.author: Jessi

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable even for bigger ladies.
customer_reviews.text: I have another weighted vest for walking and although this is lighter, (my other one goes from 1-25lbs adjustability) this new one is significantly more comfortable material. I’m 5’5 245lbs and this fits well. I was concerned the arm holes might be tight but it’s extremely comfortable for my size and the front strap would still fit someone with an even larger chest than mine. Thanks! Great product! Can’t wait to start running in this one as the weight distribution is better for running than my other one is since there’s no weights sitting directly over my chest with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Prestplan

customer_reviews.title: Working product
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a couple months and I feel it works. It helped corrected my posture. But once I wore it and jogged about one hour and then ended up with a back pain. So be careful on the length of time to wear it and the activity type to wear it. Wear it to walk for half hour seems the best fit for me.
customer_reviews.author: Yangyang

customer_reviews.title: This is a great weighted vest
customer_reviews.text: This is a great weighted vest; the best I've had thus far. I spent a lot more on other vests which were either too heavy or uncomfortable, especially since I am 5'3". This is soft, just the perfect weight and stays put even when doing high intensity intervals including plyometric work. The small front pocket is too small for my iphone 5 though, but it is handy to have or you can remove it from the vest too.
customer_reviews.author: L. Watanabe

customer_reviews.title: it stays in place when i run (don't do that if you have bad knees or back)
customer_reviews.text: the vest is small enough to wear under my sweater, and when i was thin enough i wore it under my uniform coat (it was undetectable unless i bent over or hunched). it stays in place when i run (don't do that if you have bad knees or back), do push ups and have minimal bouncing when jumping around. i wore for the majority of the day, and the body easily adjusted until i got used to it. downer: cant add or subtract weight, and the net/pocket in the back can only hold small items. pouch is also too small for newer phones.
customer_reviews.author: E Batan

customer_reviews.title: Great vests for kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these, for my 13 and 14 year old boys to use during their intense CrossFit and wrestling workouts. The price point was just what I was looking for and these got the job done. They fit their body size very well, well made (no holes, or leaking sand) and stood up to multiple workouts, runs, being thrown in the car and on the ground. Good solid vests.
customer_reviews.author: MyShoes

customer_reviews.title: love the #12 vest
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I'm 5'3 so not very tall. I wear it while walking... about 40 minutes. I also wear it while doing squats with dumbbells, and sometimes I just wear it for a few hours. Cleaning the house or out running errands. I got the #12. I wear it upside down . I have a small frame and that helps it fit snugger.
customer_reviews.author: Mz De Nina

customer_reviews.title: great over all
customer_reviews.text: i have been using this for about 2 months , wearing it 5 days a week at work under my polo work shirt (yes it is noticeable but not bad ) for 8 hrs a day and I lift 10-50 lbs boxes most of that time . This vest has held up to all and is still in great shape . I am a 6" 270 lb man and it fits good (yes there is a little padding around my middle but that's why I purchased it).
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Lee

customer_reviews.title: My favorite weighted vest!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the most comfortable and easy to wear weighted vest I’ve had on! I’ve bought a few others and tried on friends vests as well... this actually is heavier than one of my other vests and feels lighter than it because of how the weight sits. It isn’t floppy and easy to jog in as well.
customer_reviews.author: JayLee Mathis

customer_reviews.title: Soft and heavy
customer_reviews.text: For 12 lbs, it seems like a lot more. Material is nice and comfortable and not abrasive at all. The little pocket that it comes with for a cell phone might fit a nokia brick from the early 2000, but not today's phones (although this was not a selling point for me) Would easily recommend for anyone looking for something low profile.
customer_reviews.author: Mike H

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: I love this weighted vest. I had been using a slightly lighter vest that was much bulkier (extended from my collarbone to below my waist). This vest is heavier, but constructed much better. I love that the weight is distributed on the back and sides, rather than across the front. This vest doesn't cover your shirt & is comfortable to wear. It's easy & fast to put on & take off. I only wish it came in a 15-pound version.
customer_reviews.author: Attyin VA

customer_reviews.title: VERY POOR QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY. This product is absolute garbage, we purchased this in May and it lasted less than a month before several of the seams split and sand went everywhere. This is a scam, stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Valarie Orman

customer_reviews.title: good for your walks!
customer_reviews.text: Good fit for me 5'2" 120 lbs. A bit heavy, so I use it for wear around the house and a lighter one for my long walks, but this would be good for walking as well. A bit loose, so I use the other tips to wear it upside down. You can reverse the little phone pocket/keys more likely to fit. No problems with leaks at this time. A few weeks in.
customer_reviews.author: MsP

customer_reviews.title: This is the winner, so far!
customer_reviews.text: This is almost if not exactly the same as the one used on BodyRock.tv. Glad to have found it, so much less expensive. The Bodyrock host said at one time she wears it "upside down", so I do, too. Have the black elastic on top of your shoulders!!! It of course stays in place better if you have a chest for it to be snug around. It does move when doing jumping or running, but not as bad as a different brand I bought.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Klein

customer_reviews.title: This product clearly was NOT tested
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this zero stars, I would. Clearly, this product was never prototyped or tested. Most of the weight is in the back so as you walk, the back shifts down and the front shifts up, and the strap is almost at your neck before long. I have to hang two three-pound hand weight from the front strap to keep this from shifting. An absolute piece of crap. I threw mine out and bought a vest that has equal weight in front and back -- DUH!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice solid vest
customer_reviews.text: I am a 5'9 inch 165 pound male and I found the vest to fit perfectly. Initially i was looking for a 20 pound vest but decided to settle for this 12 pound one as this vest does not have any removable parts so it is more stable. Works well for doing pull-ups and box jumps, which is what I just it for mostly.
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: Good vest, large for an average frame
customer_reviews.text: Good vest and as described. I’m about 5’5 and 120 pounds this is quite big on me. While doing HIIT workouts the vest bounces all over until the buckle is eventually choking me and I have to pull it down or flip it upside down but it still bounces all over. So, if you have a lean upper body you should find something with more adjustability.
customer_reviews.author: Shore

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction, big for petite women
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought this to use during her HIIT workouts. She loves it - very comfortable, definitely brings the intensity up. Only complaint is that it is big on her. She's 5'4" and 118, and it fits pretty well when cinched all the way up but she can't use it for running or jumping as it moves around too much. She tried putting it on upside down like other reviewers suggested but it hits her chest area wrong. Great product, would be 5 stars if more adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Good product but consider heavier load if doing serious preparation
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to climb stairs with while preparing for a hiking trip. It fits well and looks nice. It seems heavy when holding it but on my shoulders the weight disappears so I wish it was a little heavier. I do notice that climbing stairs with it on causes me to labor a bit more but it's slight.
customer_reviews.author: cscstudent

customer_reviews.title: This is the one, MUST BUY!
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'3, 118lb it fits perfect and it does the job!...12lb is no joke, don't mind the cell phone holder -it won't fit your phone. The size is perfect for lipstick, keys or pepper spray!... This is well made, one thing -i wish it would adjust much more than it does but it's not crucial. This vest is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: MAGALI

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for hiking/ running
customer_reviews.text: It’s perfect for hiking and running.My knees my back everything feels great.i am very pleased with my purchase. I would highly recommend it for anyone wanting to up there endurance training. You will be very satisfied with your purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret L Contreras

customer_reviews.title: This vest is good I just had to flip it upside down to ...
customer_reviews.text: This vest is good I just had to flip it upside down to have the chest strap down lower to avoid it moving while doing burpees. Company should consider adding a strap across the lower part of the vest. Update I have only had the vest for a few weeks and use it twice a week but I notice sand coming out of it this morning. The stitching came undone so I had to sew it back up to avoid any more sand leaking.
customer_reviews.author: Burrito

customer_reviews.title: Great for hiking
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought this to help with upcoming OCR races and appreciates the quality and durability of this vest. The cell phone holder it comes with however, is useless, unless you are using a Nokia phone from the year 2000.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Fits just right.....
customer_reviews.text: I am a short female with 150 lbs, 5"0' and 36D bust. This fits me just right. The cell phone holder may not hold your phone, its too small. I use it for a protein bar though. Otherwise, this is one of the good product you can come across. I will definitely recommend this to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: HKB

customer_reviews.title: Poor fit for small or average size female
customer_reviews.text: I have used this vest for months now and it hasn't fallen apart like what happened with some of the other reviewers. Nor does it smell bad. BUT the fit is just horrible. It's too big and pulls on your neck and upper shoulders, eventually causing pain and in my case radiated up my neck causing headaches.
customer_reviews.author: kcammack1

customer_reviews.title: Great Vest for the money
customer_reviews.text: 12 pounds doesn't seem like much, but it gets heavy after a few miles. Wear it upside down for anything you need to be bouncing for, since the elastic give a little too much and will rub blisters on an unprotected neck or shoulders. Did Murph with it on memorial day, and it was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty's Girl

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Wish it was more suited for running
customer_reviews.text: I love this vest! I use it often in a group fitness class I teach, I choose a new person to wear it at each different station. I do wish that it didn't bounce so much so I could wear it more for running. It's most suited for things like squats, lunges, push-ups, and other low-impact body weight exercises. Overall though, it's a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Borders

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I'll be honest, I have to zip tie it on for HIIT. I'm a 5'3" woman and no one makes a 12lb that fits me. But I don't care - it does exactly what I need it to, once I secure it on. No quality issues or other problems.
customer_reviews.author: Damon CPA

customer_reviews.title: Why did i wait so long!
customer_reviews.text: I love this lil vest, it really adds an extra lil something during dog walks. It is small, just the right size, soft, comfortable, durable and easy to wear. Highly recommend, i walk with this (not run).
customer_reviews.author: Zildheam L. Dietrich

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: If you have never worked out with a wicked vest, you should. This one is good. It rubbed a little at first under my arms but I just had to adjust it a tad. Overall this is an easy way to up your game
customer_reviews.author: Deanna Saindon

customer_reviews.title: Works well and fits snug. I have had other ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well and fits snug. I have had other weight vests and the bounce around a lot more than this when going for a run. I can 2 miles in this with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Simple
customer_reviews.text: Simple and easy to put on. I really like this vest. Very comfortable to wear and you can even wear it upside down if that's your preference. I wear this at the gym, doing yard work and just hanging around the house. I was worried that 12 lb was a bit much to start out with, but I took a chance and I'm very glad I did. Just not sure how to clean it. Guess I will have to google it.
customer_reviews.author: tanya

customer_reviews.title: Still holding up two years later.
customer_reviews.text: Wear this almost every day while I walk. Only wish it had a more secure pocket for phone or keys, etc.
customer_reviews.author: C M

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Fits nicely but wearing it to HIIT can get awkward during things like burpees because it slides up on the neck too much. Can't get it tight enough to keep that from happening. The main strap worries me but has held up a month (12-15 classes) of use.
customer_reviews.author: D. Beirne

customer_reviews.title: Get your weight up
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good vest for walking or bodyweight exercises. My only gripe, is that the strap on the front doesn't keep the vest as snug as I want while running with it. Maybe add a bottom strap for added weight distribution and fit for running. Also would be nice to be able to add weight to it once you get acclimated.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: great vest, comfortable under all the extreme workouts I've ...
customer_reviews.text: great vest, comfortable under all the extreme workouts I've put it under. Ive worn it hiking, doing yoga, HIIT workouts, Tabatta intervals, boxing etc. I took the phone holder off because it was basically useless, but overall well worth the money and a real game changer to your workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Kuno

customer_reviews.title: Fits snug, no shifting
customer_reviews.text: Just received this vest today and had to try it out right away. I went on a 3.2 mile walk and it was very comfortable. I even ran a mile without it shifting around. It really kicked my workout up a notch. Not disappointed with this purchase at all!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sits high and snug on your chest
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to train with while rock climbing. This is the only weight vest I like since the other ones sit really low and are too loose. This one sits high and snug on your chest you it doesn’t sag, swing around or throw off your balance. Would be great for running with too. The only bad thing is you can’t change the weight in it
customer_reviews.author: jroc

customer_reviews.title: tight, uncomfortable, backpack feeling...
customer_reviews.text: It hurts your shoulders and it's very uncomfortable. The only thing I like is that you don't have to put it over your head, like the other weight vest I have, so it makes it easier to just put on and go. Also this one feels like your carrying a backpack from school with several books that hurt your back, not fun.
customer_reviews.author: Cookie83

customer_reviews.title: Cannot be worn on bare skin. Unable to run with it.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the positioning of the vest and that it doesn’t fall below the waist. I disliked that I got two very bad burns on my back from wearing it while running. The vest rubbed up against my skin and caused a burn. Very painful. So unfortunately anything you’re doing where you’re bouncing is a no go with the vest. I did use it for pull-ups and didn’t have a problem/burns.
customer_reviews.author: tiffany rios

customer_reviews.title: As described, a little awkward in the distribution of weight.
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good starter vest for walking. It distributes most weight it seems to the back, but it isn't so much weight that it causes pain. I like it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very loose, moves around a lot!
customer_reviews.text: You cannot do cardio or HIIT with this vest. It moves around so, so much. It might be good for walking or wearing around the house, doing chores, etc. I’m very disappointed because I purchase this thinking I could wear it during my HIIT workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra H.

customer_reviews.title: Great for standing exercises
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'0 120# and this does fit me quite well for standing exercises. However it does not stay put during planks or push ups. It needs a strap at the bottom. I'm also concerned that it's going to get stinky as you can't wash it. It is comfortable otherwise and is soft on the skin you don't need to wear anything underneath it and it does not rub in any spots.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Bither

customer_reviews.title: Great vest but needs to be more snug on me.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a petite person with a smaller chest. I need it to be a strap tighter on the sides, and not weigh down on such a specific part of my shoulders. I do a lot of cross training so it slips around during certain movements. Other than that, it's a great weight and potentially better for just running.
customer_reviews.author: Arianna.Brusa

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't suggest going upside down, ha ha.. Other than that this vest is comfy and adds that little extra you're looking for to push harder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for working out.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this for two years,i love it.Fits snugged and nice.I'm 5'10,175lbs male.It provide a great challenge.Weighed 13.7lbs on my bathroom scale..I use a mixture of white vinegar and isopropyl alcohol to clean it...
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Blines

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Really cool. The box itself was heavy and immediately I got scared lol however once on, it's great. The cell phone holder however is a joke. It can fit a phone from 1999 in it
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Albanese

customer_reviews.title: Great weighted vest for running etc
customer_reviews.text: Great for running. It doesn't bounce. Good fit! 5' 10" and 135lbs. So, it can adjust for whatever size you are.
customer_reviews.author: TEP

customer_reviews.title: A steal
customer_reviews.text: For the price its a steal.Its comfortable but needs a bit more padding in shoulder area.But im very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Blueflowers

customer_reviews.title: Enjoy it
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t fit really well, so it bounces around as you work out. But good addition to strength training, or when you want to challenge yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Her

customer_reviews.title: 6lbs the cell phone pocket is not made for a smart phone. Way too small
customer_reviews.text: Want to add intense to a moderate work out. This will do it! Weighed 12.6lbs the cell phone pocket is not made for a smart phone. Way too small.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Greene

customer_reviews.title: A great way to add weight to a run
customer_reviews.text: I like it. It’s comfortable to run in and has a little pocket for gel or keys or what not. Although heavy to pick up, it doesn’t feel like much on, so it works beautifully
customer_reviews.author: An interested party

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: The is so much better then the other vest I have. It is comfortable and fits a female form the way it should. I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: MsE

customer_reviews.title: I like the feel of the vest
customer_reviews.text: What a difference this vest makes during work outs. I like the feel of the vest, and it goes on easily. My only complaint is during push ups and such exercises it does ride up around my neck. Now with that said, I will not give it less stars because everyones frame is different. Overall, it's made such a huge difference. I use it all the time, and I can feel myself getting stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Nay Hubb

customer_reviews.title: Weight vest
customer_reviews.text: Love it very much! The only down fall move a lot while running. During works out does a fantastic job! Very comfortable on my shoulders.
customer_reviews.author: Ruby Juarez

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: So this happened today and I've only used this twice
customer_reviews.author: Saniqua McMahan

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Buy it can need 2 second shake occasionally to distribute weight evenly
customer_reviews.author: Chi

customer_reviews.title: Quality product, fits well
customer_reviews.text: Fits well. I removed the little pocket on the vest which is easy to do since it’s Velcro. The vest fits me very well and I am 5’3” and 195 lbs. it’s a good way to make you keep good posture and get just a bit more out of your walking or other exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Boze

customer_reviews.title: great product.
customer_reviews.text: great fit and is adjust to everyone. will back again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Does everything it says it will and very easy to put on. The weight is evenly distributed so I don’t feel like I’m going to topple over on one side or the other.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Perez

customer_reviews.title: Works well!!
customer_reviews.text: Works well!! Would buy again but so wish it could fit a bit snugger so it didn’t bounce when running with it on
customer_reviews.author: KWEN A PETERSON

customer_reviews.title: I really like the vest
customer_reviews.text: I really like the vest... BUT... the strap that goes across the chest DOES NOT stay tight. There WAS a cheap piece of cloth that WAS suppose to hold it the strap in place, the piece of cloth was stitched together with ONLY 2 stitches and came apart the first time I attempted to use it. This would be a great vest if the buckle/strap would adjust and stay tight.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl G.

customer_reviews.title: Empty Box Surprise
customer_reviews.text: My Son ordered item so he can work out during off season. What a surprise, the box was empty. Where is the quality control? There is a big difference between 12lbs and an empty box.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome Turner

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I feel like this is pretty decent. My only problem is how heavy it feels on my shoulders, I can still finish a workout with this on though. I think it feels heavy at first, but with all exercise, it gets lighter. Worth it if you can't find one in a store near you.
customer_reviews.author: Becks

customer_reviews.title: not just on the back like a back
customer_reviews.text: wanted something where the weight was evenly distributed, not just on the back like a back pack
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Lee

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend! I’m a female, 5’3, 120 lbs, average strength, & this is perfect for walking! I have no idea what the other reviews are talking about a phone holder. I see no phone holder, but I still love it!
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable stays in place have used it for walking and on elliptical
customer_reviews.author: Andrea N.

customer_reviews.title: This vest is actually really nice. It's comfortable and snug
customer_reviews.text: This vest is actually really nice. It's comfortable and snug. However, I am giving it 3 stars because I had to return it due to chest size. I am woman, size 36C and this is NOT a vest that is large bust friendly. The clamp connects right in the middle of the chest, making it unflattering and uncomfortable for "the ladies". I would suggest this vest for only men or smaller chested women.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Good Vest
customer_reviews.text: Its a good quality vest but not great for anyone with broad shoulders. Did not fit me very well.
customer_reviews.author: jacob sartain

customer_reviews.title: Not as snug as it could be
customer_reviews.text: Nice vest , although the vest moves quite a bit when You jump around even when it is on the tightest fit
customer_reviews.author: Ame Salcedo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: This product is comfortable and fits great. The reflectors are nice and I love the color!
customer_reviews.author: Emma P.

customer_reviews.title: Made to fit women
customer_reviews.text: I love this weighted vest. It fits me perfectly and is also adjustible which is good. I use it for my daily walk of about 2-3 miles. I would definitely recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: F. Saulsberry

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely no complaints
customer_reviews.text: This makes my workouts more challenging and satisfying without being uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Mercy Thompson

customer_reviews.title: great to go run i get a great work
customer_reviews.text: great to go run i get a great work out
customer_reviews.author: MAREOOOH

customer_reviews.title: Great buy - very pleased
customer_reviews.text: It's very comfy and gives me the extra push during at home HIIT workouts - no chaffing, shifting, and it sits better if you wear it upside down :)
customer_reviews.author: Camille

customer_reviews.title: Good for workout
customer_reviews.text: My dr recommended a weighted vest for my workout so I brought this one. It works.
customer_reviews.author: aprilchild80

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied!!! ☺
customer_reviews.text: I really like it I bought it to use it when doing squats wanna get bigger butt haja xD Also I think its less expensive than buying one at target.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Soto

customer_reviews.title: Could use a few tweaks to make it better
customer_reviews.text: I really like this.. It adds quite a bit to your workout but... I think it is man sized. It cannot be tightened enough so it bounces when you use it for jumpy exercises.. and it can become quite uncomfortable. I wear it upside down which, is much more comfortable but I have noticed that the elastic is beginning to run.. meaning that it wont be long till I can probably only use it for a slow walk as opposed to HIIT.
customer_reviews.author: New Product Addict

customer_reviews.title: its one of the best addition for body weight training exercises
customer_reviews.text: quiet heavy for a beginner then you ll get used to it. i wear it up side down, and its doesnt fit very snug. im 5'9 and 130lbs. its one of the best addition for body weight training exercises. i do recommend and i wish they made a 6lbs one.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bye
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness, best fit ever for a female. Love the quality the durability and it is the perfect weight
customer_reviews.author: krystal00t

customer_reviews.title: It's not bad. I just wish it had more of an ...
customer_reviews.text: It's large on my torso and slides back while walking. It's not bad. I just wish it had more of an adjustable strap to make it fit properly .
customer_reviews.author: Ann Harlan

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my workout
customer_reviews.text: Heavy at first but you get accustomed to it very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: J. R.

customer_reviews.title: Too big for me...
customer_reviews.text: Product appeared to be well made, but it was way too big. It would not stay put. It shifted around constantly and it could not be made any tighter. I had to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: karyn

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for posture improvement potentially. I used it for a little while and had some success. I think it is made for women and I'm a fairly big guy so it looked a little funny on me. Not to be worn in public but can give you some added weight at home and does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: LOVE. This is great for cardio
customer_reviews.text: LOVE. This is great for cardio! I am very petite so it's a little big and moves around a lot when I run even pulled tight but I'm still very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: This is a good weight for walking
customer_reviews.text: This is a good weight for walking. But I did notice it can become painfully after wearing for about an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

product_meta.title: Tone Fitness Weighted Vest, 12 lbs
feature_bullets: CONSTRUCTION - Made with soft neoprene material for a comfortable feel
VERSATILE - One size fits most Burn more calories, increase bone density, and increase intensity of workouts by wearing this weighted vest
FEATURES - Adjustable front belt for snug fit Reflective strips for visibility in the dark
FUNCTIONAL - Wear this vest for exercising, walking, distance running or speed, agility and quickness drills
CHOICES - Available in blue and black
